body_html:
Yeah sorry I knew that (dense, dense) > dense was already there, just was listing out the complete set that should exist, even if some of them already do.

One example where I’ve had issues with sparse is the masked_select(), which, as of 0.4.0 or 0.4.1 (can’t remember which) couldn’t take a sparse byte mask, which I feel like is an obvious use case. Maybe I don’t have the latest that might fix that, though.

Anyway, appreciate the work; I know this stuff can get very complicated. PyTorch is much more intuitive than other frameworks I’ve read up on.

body:
Yeah sorry I knew that (dense, dense) > dense was already there, just was listing out the complete set that should exist, even if some of them already do.

One example where I’ve had issues with sparse is the masked_select(), which, as of 0.4.0 or 0.4.1 (can’t remember which) couldn’t take a sparse byte mask, which I feel like is an obvious use case. Maybe I don’t have the latest that might fix that, though.

Anyway, appreciate the work; I know this stuff can get very complicated. PyTorch is much more intuitive than other frameworks I’ve read up on.
